Equipment and Equipment Warranty — RTU-1

Same scope as RTU-2
  • Disconnect all low-voltage wiring (control wiring)
  • Provide crane and necessary rigging to remove existing packaged rooftop unit from existing location
  • Remove existing packaged rooftop unit from existing location, remove from premise, and legally dispose of unit
  • Fly curb adapter (provided with equipment by owner) onto the roof
  • Provide necessary crane and rigging to place curb adapter on existing roof curb
  • Utilize crane and provide necessary rigging to place new packaged rooftop unit (provided by owner) on the curb adapter and seal properly
  • Properly seal and sit new packaged rooftop unit on curb adapter
  • Provide and install new digital thermostat
  • Complete project in accordance with all necessary city, county and/or state building code requirements (including but not limited to, hurricane tie-down straps)
  • Pull all necessary building permits from proper city, county or state code enforcement agency
  • The scope of work for being awarded this project includes delivering a fully operating system
  • Install unit in accordance to manufacture’s IOM (installation and operation manual)
  • Provide authorized technician for start-up and first year warranty
  • First year warranty to include all parts, all labor and any after hours emergency call for the first year
